dialogues.CORALINE:
[1]Written by 
[2]Hello?...   Who's there? 
[3]You scared me to death, you mangy thing! 
[4]I'm just looking for an old well. Know it? 
[5]Not talking, huh? 
[6]Magic dowser, magic dowser: show... me... the well! 
[7]
[8]
[9]
[10]And I DON'T LIKE BEING STALKED, not by 
[11]Look, I'm from Pontiac. 
[12]MICHIGAN? And if I'm a "water witch", 
[13]Huh. 
[14]What do you mean? 
[15]Wybie? 
[16]I wasn't saddled with anything. It's Coraline. 
[17]Coraline. Coraline Jones. 
[18]I think I heard someone calling you, Wyborne. 
[19]Oh, I definitely heard someone, Why-were- you-born. 
[20]Why? 
[21]Ehh!! 
[22]I almost fell down a well yesterday, Mom. 
[23]I would have died. 
[24]Hmmm. So can I go out? I think it's perfect weather for gardening. 
[25]But Mom, I want stuff growing when my friends come to visit. Isn't that why we moved here? 
[26]Wasn't my fault you hit that truck. 
[27]I can't believe it -- you and Dad get paid to write about plants and you hate dirt. 
[28]That sounds exciting. Oh - some kid left this on the front porch. 
[29]Huh... a little me? That's weird. 
[30]Wybie. And I'm way too old for dolls. 
[31]Hey Dad, how's the writing going?... Dad? 
[32]D'you know where the garden tools are? 
[33]Humph, it's just raining. 
[34]"Don't even think about going out, Coraline Jones." 
[35]So? 
[36]Ewww! 
[37]Ahh!! 
[38]One boring blue boy in a painfully boring painting ... four incredibly boring windows ... and no... more... doors... 
[39]All right, little me, where are you hiding? 
[40]Huh? 
[41]Hey Mom... 
[42]Where does this door go? 
[43]I think it's locked. 
[44]Pleeeeeeeeease! 
[45]Bricks? I don't get it. 
[46]You're kidding? And why is the door so small? 
[47]You didn't lock it. 
[48]Why don't you ever cook, Mom? 
[49]Looks more like slime to me. 
[50]Think they're trying to poison me? 
[51]Don't forget about me, guys. Okay? 
[52]Good-night...little me. 
[53]Whoa... 
[54]Huh? 
[55]MMMMM, something smells good. 
[56]Mom?! What are you doing here in the middle of the night? 
[57]You're not my mother. 
[58]My mother doesn't have b-b-buh... 
[59]Hello? 
[60]My father can't play piano. 
[61]I, uh ­ sorry ­ but she said to tell you the food's ready. 
[62]Mmmm, this chicken is good. 
[63]D'you have any gravy? 
[64]I'm real thirsty. 
[65]Mango milk shake? 
[66]Home? 
[67]For me? 
[68]I didn't know I had an Other Mother. 
[69]Really? 
[70]You mean like, hide and seek? 
[71]What rain? 
[72]Huh, what about the mud? 
[73]How'd you know I-- 
[74]I, I'd love to play, but ... I better get home to my other mother. 
[75]I mean my other other mother. Mom number one? I think I should get to bed. 
[76]But ... 
[77]Wow. 
[78]Hello. 
[79]Kripes a-mighty, how are my best trolls? I can't wait till summer. You're both comin', right? 
[80]Oh, the mud... 
[81]It's gone, my poison oak, it's gone!... 
[82]Huh? 
[83]It was incredibly real, Mom! Only you weren't really you; you were my other mother. 
[84]You were in the dream too, Dad. You had wild-looking pajamas and orange monkey slippers. 
[85]Miss Spink and Forcible? But you said they're dingbats. 
[86]Bo-bin-sky...Bo-bin-sky....Bo-bin-sky... 
[87]Ohh, Poo-eeeee! 
[88]H-hello?... 
[89]I think our mail got mixed up.    Should I leave it outside or... 
[90]Hmmm... 
[91]Circus?... Oh, uh, I brought this for you. 
[92]Huh? 
[93]Meeshkas? 
[94]Oh, sorry. I'm Coraline Jones. 
[95]Cor-a-line. 
[96]Oompah oompah, toodle toot, toodle toot. 
[97]No!!! 
[98]The...jumping mice? 
[99]The one behind the wall paper? But... it's all bricked up. 
[100]Still Coraline, Miss Spink. 
[101]Are those dogs .... real? 
[102]Read what? 
[103]A what? 
[104]What do you see? 
[105]Well, what should I do? 
[106]No, I guess not. Thanks for the tea, though. 
[107]Danger? 
[108]Great, the village stalker. 
[109]What d'ya mean, "we?" 
[110]Ha! Your cat's not wild, he's a wuss- puss! 
[111]Wuss-puss... 
[112]So... that doll. Did you make it look like me? 
[113]C'mom - blue hair, my swampers and raincoat? 
[114]You're just like them. 
[115]I meant my parents; they don't listen to me either. 
[116]Ew! 
[117]You're kidding. 
[118]Dangerous? 
[119]So? 
[120]Stolen? 
[121]Well, what do you think? 
[122]Wait a minute! 
[123]Hi. 
[124]Cheddar?... Oh, the mice bait... 
[125]You mean my Other Father? 
[126]Mmmmmm! 
[127]I love your garden! 
[128]Oh ah, stop! Stop tickling, ah! 
[129]Well, she says it's time for dinner ... breakfast ... food? 
[130]I can't believe you did this! 
[131]Mmmm...so good! 
[132]Really. That know-it-all Wybie said it was all in Mr. B's head, I knew he was wrong. 
[133]My friend? 
[134]Great... another Wybie. Hello, Why-were- you-born. 
[135]Hello? 
[136]So he can't talk at all? 
[137]Hmm, I like it. 
[138]You're awful cheerful, considering you can't say anything. 
[139]Uh...It didn't hurt, did it, when she... 
[140]Whoa... cool! 
[141]Look at you! 
[142]My name! 
[143]It's wonderful, Wybie! 
[144]Wow! 
[145]Yah! Whooo-oooh! That was great! 
[146]We loved it, Mr. B. It was ... so ... so-- 
[147]A-mazing! 
[148]Ughhh. 
[149]Oh, and upstairs I saw a real mouse circus, not pretend like the crazy man's in our house. 
[150]Da-ad! I'm not five anymore. 
[151]But Mom, the whole school's gonna wear boring gray clothes. No one will have these. 
[152]My other mother would get them. 
[153]So what do you think's in the other apartment? 
[154]Then why'd you lock the door? 
[155]They're jumping-mice, Mom! And the dreams aren't dangerous; they're the most fun I've had since we've moved here. 
[156]With those stupid uniforms?   Right. 
[157]Are you kidding me? 
[158]Gross-gusting. 
[159]Oh, like the gloves? 
[160]That's what you always say. 
[161]But I might be... 
[162]I knew it was real! 
[163]Hmmm... Wybie's got a cat like you at home. Not the quiet Wybie; the one that talks too much. You must be the Other Cat. 
[164]Um... I can see you don't have button eyes. But if you're the same cat, how can you talk? 
[165]Cats don't talk at home. 
[166]Nope. 
[167]Come back. Please? I... I'm sorry I called you that, I really am. 
[168]How'd you get here? 
[169]The Other Mother hates cats? 
[170]What do you mean? She's amazing! 
[171]That's nonsense. He can't talk. 
[172]Hey, Wybie. 
[173]She's practically naked! 
[174]Oh my God. 
[175]I can't look! 
[176]Ahhh!!! 
[177]Yeah!! 
[178]Oh yeah. They swooped down and pulled me right out of my seat ­ Spink and Forcible. Only they weren't old ladies, that was just a disguise. But then, I was flying through the air and... it was, it was magic. 
[179]Uh-huh! Good night, Wybie. 
[180]Really? 
[181]What's that? 
[182]
[183]
[184]I'm... I'm going to bed! RIGHT NOW! 
[185]I'm really, really tired. Yeah... I just need to sleep on things. 
[186]Oh, no thanks, uh, you-you've done so much already-- 
[187]I'm going home tonight, robots - and I won't be back. 
[188]Go to sleep, go to sleep, go to sleep, go to sleep! 
[189]Go to sleep, go to sleep, go to sleep... 
[190]Go to sleep, go to sleep, go to sleep... 
[191]Mom!... Dad!.. 
[192]Oh God, I'm still here? 
[193]Hey you! Where's the Other Mother?     I want to go home. 
[194]If you won't even talk to me, I'm gonna find the Other Wybie. He'll help me. 
[195]Well, I'm gettin' outta here. That's what I'M doing. 
[196]Huh? Something's wrong. Shouldn't the old well be here? 
[197]But why? Why does she want me? 
[198]Eat? That's ridiculous, mothers don't eat daughters! 
[199]Huh? But how can you walk away from something and still come back to it? 
[200]Small world. 
[201]Stop, he's one of the circus mice! 
[202]Gooooood kitty. 
[203]I want to be with my real mom and dad. I want you to let me go. 
[204]You aren't my mother. 
[205]No. 
[206]Ow, what are you doing! 
[207]Ow, that hurts! 
[208]Who's there? 
[209]You ... you mean the Other Mother? ... 
[210]Who are you? 
[211]Why are you all here? 
[212]Well, she can't keep me in the dark forever; not if she wants to win my life. Beating her is my only chance. 
[213]Has she taken those, too? 
[214]I ... I'll try. 
[215]
[216]Did she do this to you? 
[217]I hope that feels bet-- 
[218]Let's go! 
[219]Come on. She'll hurt you again! 
[220]
[221]Anybody here? Hello, hello, hello! Real Dad ... Real Mom! 
[222]Oh, Mom's groceries! 
[223]Uhhh. That's disgusting. 
[224]I missed you guys so much-- You'll never-- 
[225]Oh... the Wybie that talks... 
[226]You stole that doll, didn't you? 
[227]It used to look like this pioneer girl; then Huck Finn junior; then it was this Little Rascals chick with all these ribbons, and braids, and.... 
[228]Grandma's missing sister! 
[229]I think I just met her. C'mon! 
[230]She's in there. 
[231]Not in a million years. But it wouldn't matter; she can't escape without her eyes. None of the ghosts can. 
[232]Great! I'd love to get rid of it! 
[233]Where are you hiding, you little monster?! 
[234]The doll's her spy! It's how she watches you, finds out what's wrong with your life! 
[235]NO! - the Other Mother! She's got this whole world where everything's better - the food, the garden, the-- --neighbors. 
[236]But it's all a trap! 
[237]Don't believe me?... You can ask the cat! 
[238]You're not LISTENING TO ME! 
[239]You creep! 
[240]Crazy?... You're the jerk-wad that gave me the doll! 
[241]Mom!   Dad! 
[242]Pick it up, Dad, pick it up. 
[243]Dad!   Whe- 
[244]Where have you gone? 
[245]Uh... don't you only make wings for the ... dead ones? 
[246]How is hundred-year-old candy going to 
[247]What's it for? 
[248]Good-night, Mom. Good-night, Dad. 
[249]Hello. How did you get in? 
[250]Do you know where Mom and Dad are? 
[251]
[252]How did this happen? 
[253]She's taken them. 
[254]They're not coming back, are they ­ Mom and Dad. Not on their own. 
[255]Only one thing to do. 
[256]I have to go back. 
[257]They are my parents. 
[258]Hmmm, okay. 
[259]Mom? 
[260]
[261]Where are my parents? 
[262]They weren't bored of me.   You stole them! 
[263]Why don't you have your own key? 
[264]Mom, Dad, where'd she hide you? 
[265]Be strong, Coraline. 
[266]Why don't we play ... a game? I know you like them. 
[267]Uh huh. 
[268]An exploring game ... a finding things game. 
[269]My real parents. 
[270]And, and the eyes of the ghost children. 
[271]If I lose, I'll stay here with you forever and let you love me. And I'll let you sew buttons into my eyes. 
[272]Then you let me go. You let everyone go ­ my real father and mother, the dead children, everyone you've trapped here. 
[273]Not till you give me a clue. 
[274]And for my parents? 
[275]Fine. Don't tell me... 
[276]...it's a deal-- 
[277]What does she mean "wonders?" 
[278]Hmmm. 
[279]No!! 
[280]Stop!! 
[281]Why steal this? 
[282]Wow... 
[283]That must be it. 
[284]Don't worry, I'm getting the hang of it! 
[285]The pearl! 
[286]Oh, Wybie... 
[287]
[288]I'm Coraline. 
[289]Uh-huh. 
[290]You don't get it, do you? 
[291]Of course you don't understand. You're just a copy she made of the real Mr. B. 
[292]Ahhh! No!! 
[293]
[294]Noooo! 
[295]Oh God, I've lost the game; I've lost everything. 
[296]I think you might have said something like that. 
[297]Thank you. 
[298]I'm heading inside. I still have to find my parents. 
[299]Come on, quickly! 
[300]No, I ... I brought a friend. 
[301]You, you have a very funny way of showing it. 
[302]Hold on. 
[303]We aren't finished yet, are we? 
[304]I already know where you've hidden them. 
[305]They're behind that door. 
[306]Mom.   Dad! 
[307]Go on.   Open it. They'll be there, all right. 
[308]No ... I'm ... 
[309]
[310]
[311]Mom! Dad! I missed you so much! 
[312]I didn't break it. It must've broke when you escaped. 
[313]
[314]You're talking about... your garden catalog? 
[315]But look at the snow on your clothes...? 
[316]So, gonna order the tulips? 
[317]For the garden party!! 
[318]Dad! 
[319]So, Mom. Invitations? Don't forget the invitations. 
[320]Mr. B's not drunk, Mom, he's just...eccentric. 
[321]Oh, hello again. 
[322]You still mad? 
[323]I'm really sorry I threw you at her - the Other Mother? ­ it was all I could think of. 
[324]I think it's time, don't you? To set them free? 
[325]Well, I'm glad it's finally over! 
[326]What about...me? 
[327]But how?   I locked the door!? 
[328]I -- I've gotta hide this somewhere, s- somewhere she can never ... 
[329]Outta my way! 
[330]Oh.... my twitchy witchy girl, I think you are so nice ... 
[331]... I give you bowls of porridge And I give you bowls of ice cream. 
[332]I give you lots of kisses, And I give you lots of hugs ... 
[333]... But I never give you sandwiches With grease and worms and mung beans. 
[334]Why did you change your mind? 
[335]The sweet ghost girl. 
[336]Just bring her by the house tomorrow.      We can tell her together. 
[337]You know, I'm glad you decided to stalk me. 
[338]Thanks for helping me, Miss Spink, Miss Forcible. 
[339]Actually, it's just lemonade. 
[340]How's Angus doing? 
[341]Cold drinks? 
[342]Thanks, mom. 
[343]How are the meeshkas, Mr. B? 
[344]Welcome, Ms. Lovat! 
[345]I'm Coraline Jones -- I've got so much to tell you!
dialogues.WYBIE:
[1]Hoo! Let me guess, you're from Texas or Utah; someplace dried out and barren, right? I heard about water-witching before but it doesn't make sense; I mean, it's just an ordinary branch. 
[2]Ow! 
[3]He's not really my cat; he's kinda feral ­ you know, wild? Of course, I do feed him every night and sometimes he'll come in my window `n bring me little dead things. 
[4]Huh? 
[5]You stomp too hard and you'll fall in it! 
[6]See? Supposed to be so deep if you fell to the bottom and looked up, you'd see a sky full of stars in the middle of the day. 
[7]Surprised she let you move in... 
[8]... my Gramma. She owns the "Pink Palace" Won't rent to people with kids. 
[9]Uh... I'm not supposed to talk about it. 
[10]I'm Wybie, Wybie Lovat. 
[11]Short for Wyborne. Not my idea, of course. What'd you get saddled with? 
[12]Caroline what? 
[13]Hmmm... It's not real scientific, but I heard an ordinary name, like Caroline -- 
[14]-- can lead people to have ordinary expectations about a person-- 
[15]What? I didn't hear anything-- 
[16]Grandma! 
[17]Heh. Well, great to meet a Michigan water witch. 
[18]But I'd wear gloves next time. 
[19]`Cause that dowsing rod of yours? Uh, it's poison oak. 
[20]Hey Jonesy, look what I found in Gramma's trunk. Look familiar? Wybie. 
[21]Owwwwwwww! 
[22]Ow. I - I wasn't stalking you. We're hunting banana slugs. 
[23]What? He hates to get his feet wet. Geez. 
[24]Oh no; I found it that way. It's older than Gramma -- old as this house prob'ly. 
[25]Dang, check out Slugzilla! 
[26]Huh? 
[27]Uh huh... You mind? 
[28]You know, I've never been inside the Pink Palace. 
[29]Grandma would kill me. Thinks it's dangerous or something. 
[30]Well... she had a twin sister. 
[31]Uhhh, I-I don't know. 
[32]Maybe she just ran away? 
[33]Look, I gotta go. 
[34]Huh? Ha ha ha....yeah... Um, so you know tha-that old doll I gave you? 
[35]Um... my Gramma's real mad, says it was her sister's - the one that... disappeared? 
[36]Uh, listen, I-I-I'm really not supposed 
[37]C-can you ­ can you unlock it? 
[38]Huhhhhhh... So, uh, I really need to get that doll? 
[39]You and Gramma been talking? 
[40]The doll...is my Gramma's...spy. 
[41]Yeah... Uh, I think I heard someone calling me, Jonesy. 
[42]The cat... I-I'll just tell Gramma that you couldn't find the doll-- OW! 
[43]That's ... cause ... you're CRAZY! 
[44]Crazy!! 
[45]
[46]Get off!! 
[47]I-I'm really sorry I didn't believe you about all this ... evil stuff, Coraline. 
[48]W-well, Gramma showed me this picture, after I called you crazy? 
[49]Oh, man...what am I going to tell her? 
[50]We...we can?? 
[51]Wasn't my idea.
dialogues.OTHER MOTHER:
[1]You're just in time for supper, dear! 
[2]B-b-b-buttons? Do you like them? 
[3]I'm your Other Mother, silly. Now go tell your Other Father that supper's ready. 
[4]Well, go on. He's in his study. 
[5]Hungry, aren't you. 
[6]Well, here comes the gravy train! Choo- choo! 
[7]Another roll, sweet peas? Corn on the cob? 
[8]Of course! Any requests? 
[9]We've been waiting for you, Coraline. 
[10]Of course you do. Everyone does. 
[11]Uh huh, and soon as you're through eating, I thought we'd play a game. 
[12]Perfect! Hide and seek in the rain. 
[13]Mud facials, mud baths, mud pies -- it's great for poison oak. 
[14]But I'm your other mother. 
[15]Of course, sweetheart, it's all made up. 
[16]Welcome back, darling. 
[17]So thoughtful of you to send this nice cheddar, Coraline. 
[18]Would you go fetch your father? 
[19]Bet he's hungry as a pumpkin by now! 
[20]Your better father, dear.   He's out in the garden. 
[21]Go on... 
[22]Coraline, Mr. Bobinsky has invited you to come see the Jumping Mice perform after dinner. 
[23]Your father and I will clean up while you and your friend head upstairs. 
[24]I thought you'd like him more, if he spoke a little less. So I fixed him. 
[25]Nope. 
[26]Now run along, you two, and have fun. 
[27]Dearest Coraline, 
[28]Was it wonderful, dear? 
[29]You do like it here, don't you, Coraline? 
[30]You could stay here forever... if you want to. 
[31]There's one tiny little thing we need to do. 
[32]For you ... our little doll. 
[33]Black is traditional, but if you'd prefer pink or vermillion or chartreuse... 
[34]... though you might make me jealous. 
[35]Oh, but we need a yes ... if you want to stay here. 
[36]There now; it's your decision, darling. We only want what's best for you. 
[37]Bed? 
[38]Well of course you do, darling... I'll be happy to tuck you in. 
[39]You're welcome. And I ­ we aren't worried at all, darling. Soon you'll see things our way. 
[40]There's just one tiny little thing we have to do. 
[41]Soon you'll see things our way... 
[42]They say even the proudest -- 
[43]--spirit can be broken ... with love. 
[44]Of course, chocolate never hurts. Like one? 
[45]They're Cocoa Beetles from Zanzibar. 
[46]Is that any way to talk to your mother? 
[47]Apologize at once, Coraline! 
[48]I'll give you to the count of three. One... 
[49]...two... 
[50]And what is it you'd be finding, Coraline?
dialogues.MEL:
[1]Uh huh. 
[2]That's nice. 
[3]No, Coraline. Rain makes mud. Mud makes a mess. 
[4]Something like that. But then we had the accident. 
[5]I never said it was. 
[6]Coraline, I don't have time for you right now. And you still have unpacking to do. Lots of unpacking. 
[7]What's his name, anyway? 
[8]I'm really, really busy! 
[9]
[10]Uhhh... 
[11]Will you stop pestering me if I do this for you? 
[12]Fine. 
[13]They must have closed this off when they divided up the house. 
[14]We made a deal. ZIP IT! 
[15]AaaaaH!!! 
[16]Coraline, we've been through this before: your Dad cooks, I clean, and you stay out of the way. 
[17]I swear I'll go food shopping soon as we finish the catalog. Try some of the chard, you need a vegetable. 
[18]Buttons for eyes, huh? Coraline, you only dreamed you ate all that chicken. Take your multi-vitamin, at least. 
[19]If the real Charlie Jones wants his pages edited, he'd better wrap them up ASAP. 
[20]Coraline, why don't you go visit downstairs? I bet those "actresses" would love to hear your dream. 
[21]Uh huh. 
[22]Don't fret, Charlie, they'll love the new catalog. At least, they'll love my chapters. 
[23]I did not call him crazy, Coraline.   He's drunk. 
[24]Put them back. 
[25]Put them back. 
[26]Maybe she should buy all your clothes. 
[27]I don't know. Not a family of Jones imposters. 
[28]Oh, I found some rat crap and... I thought you'd feel ... safer. 
[29]Your school might be fun. 
[30]Had to give it a try. 
[31]How do you feel about a mustard-ketchup- salsa wrap for lunch? 
[32]Mmm... Had to go food shopping anyway. Dad's planning something special. 
[33]You wanna come along? You can pick out something you like. 
[34]Look, Coraline... if things go well today, I promise I'll make it up. 
[35]Won't be long. 
[36]Coraline? We're home! 
[37]Missed us? 
[38]Oh no, you broke my favorite snow globe. 
[39]And cut your knee. 
[40]Well, get yourself cleaned up, we're going out tonight. 
[41]Of course! What else? 
[42]What's gotten into you, Coraline? 
[43]Even Bobinsky? 
[44]Charlie! 
[45]You were right, Coraline. I really hate dirt, but the tulips look nice. 
[46]Here.
dialogues.MISS SPINK:
[1]Oh cease your infernal yapping! How nice to see you, Caroline. Would you like to come in? We're playing cards. 
[2]Miriam, put the kettle on! 
[3]It's the new neighbor, Miriam - Caroline? She'll be having the Oolong tea. 
[4]No, Oolong. 
[5]Come on, boys! 
[6]Our sweet, departed angels. Couldn't bear to part with them ... so we had them stuffed. 
[7]Now, there's Hamish the third, the fourth, the eighth, the ninth. Angus the second, the fifth, the.. 
[8]...seventh, the third, the ninth, yes, the fourthI'm right; and Jock Junior, Jock senior, Jock the third, the fourth... 
[9]...oh, and that's Jock's 2nd cousin, twice removed. 
[10]I'll read them, if you like. 
[11]Oh, your tea leaves, dear. They'll tell me your future. Drink up then, go on. 
[12]No, not all of it, not all of it. That's right, now hand it over. 
[13]Oh... Caroline, Caroline, Caroline; you are in terrible danger. 
[14]My eyes! You're blind as a bat! 
[15]Miriam, oh really, you're holding it wrong. 
[16]See? Danger! 
[17]I see a very peculiar hand... 
[18]Giraffes don't just fall from the sky, Miriam. 
[19]Oh! 
[20]Never wear green in your dressing room. 
[21]And be very, very careful. Now, was there something you came to tell us? 
[22]Cheery-bye. 
[23]Do you have any nice Queens for mummy? 
[24]Just looking ahead dear... Angus hasn't been feeling very well of late. 
[25]We've lost our ride, Miriam. Caroline says her parents have vanished, quite completely. 
[26]I suppose we could walk! 
[27]Oh, oh yes ... your missing parents. We know just what you need. Miriam, get...that's right. 
[28]There you go, sweety. 
[29]Well,it might help. They're good for bad things, sometimes. 
[30]It's bad things, Miriam. 
[31]Bad. 
[32]Bad things! 
[33]Bad. 
[34]Oh, much better, dear... But he can't duck his wings forever! 
[35]Ooo, do you want to pop a little gin in it dear?
dialogues.OTHER FATHER:
[1]Hello, Coraline. Want to hear my new song? 
[2]No need to ... this piano plays ME! 
[3]Making up a song about Coraline. She's a peach, she's a doll, she's a pal of mine. She's as cute as a button in the eyes of everyone who ever laid their eyes on Cor- a-line. 
[4]When she comes around exploring Mom and I will never ever make it boring our eyes will be on Coraline. 
[5]Mmmmm! Who's starving? Raise your hand. 
[6]We give our thanks and ask to bless, Our Mother's golden chicken breast! 
[7]Yep. Wasn't the same here without you, kiddo. 
[8]We love mud here! 
[9]Come along, sleepyhead. 
[10]Hey!!! 
[11]Our garden, Coraline! 
[12]Oops, daughter in distress! 
[13]Tickle no more, you dragon snappers! 
[14]Hop on, kiddo, I want to show you something! 
[15]Mother said you'd like it! Boy she knows you like the back of her hand. 
[16]I love dinner, breakfast food. 
[17]Well, everything's right in this world, Kiddo. 
[18]Hey there. 
[19]Sure...we'll sing and play games, and Mother will cook your favorite meals. 
[20]Well, it's a surprise. 
[21]So sharp you won't feel a thi-- Oww! 
[22]Before dinner? 
[23]So sharp you won't feel a thing... 
[24]All will be swell, soon as Mother's refreshed. Her strength is our strength. 
[25]Mustn't talk when Mother's not here. 
[26]No point; he pulled a long face... 
[27]...and Mother didn't like it. 
[28]Only one key. 
[29]Squish squash, pumpkin sauce... 
[30]Sorrry, so sorrry, Motherrr making meeee. 
[31]Don't waaaanno hurrrrrt you. 
[32]Taaaake it!!!!!
dialogues.CHARLIE:
[1]Hello, Coraline... And... Coraline doll?... 
[2]It's pouring out there, isn't it. 
[3]What'd the boss say? 
[4]Then you won't need the tools. 
[5]Uhhh, you know, this house is a hundred and fifty years old. 
[6]So explore it! 
[7]Go out and ... count all the doors and windows and write that down. List everything blue! Just let me work. 
[8]No, no, no, no, no; GAAAA--! 
[9]
[10]Oh, my twitchy witchy girl, 
[11]I think you are so nice, I give you bowls of porridge And I give you bowls of ice -- 
[12]-- cream! 
[13]Well, it's slime or bedtime fusspot -- now what's it going to be? 
[14]Orange? My monkey slippers are blue. 
[15]Pssst. Can you get me some of that magic mud you were talking about? 
[16]Because I have a terrible case of writer's rash. On my---. 
[17]You sure you won't come? 
[18]Well, I guess I'll see you around, you dizzy dreamer. 
[19]Hi! 
[20]I'm digging in my garden right now, but leave a message and I'll get right back to you. 
[21]Coraline, I asked you to count all the windows, not put your knee through them. 
[22]We gotta lot to celebrate! 
[23]What's that? 
[24]I have no idea what you're talking about. 
[25]Good night, Coraline. 
[26]Here comes a burp. 
[27]Oh, excu-say-moi, but that pizza was delicious. 
[28]Oh yeah, great! 
[29]Thanks.
dialogues.CAT:
[1]No. I'm not the other anything. I'm me. 
[2]I just can. 
[3]No? 
[4]Well, you're clearly the expert on these things. After all, I'm just a big fat wuss puss. 
[5]I've been coming here for a while. 
[6]It's a game we play. She... ...hates cats and tries to keep me out. But she can't, of course. 
[7]I come and go as I please. 
[8]Not like any "mother" I've ever known. 
[9]You probably think this world is a dream come true. But you're wrong. The Other Wybie told me so. 
[10]Perhaps not to you. We cats, however, have far superior senses than humans and can see and smell, and -- 
[11]Shhhh! I hear something! Right ...over... 
[12]And what do you think you're doing? 
[13]Nothing out here ... it's the empty part of this world. She only made what she knew would impress you. 
[14]She wants something to love, I think. Something that isn't her... Or maybe she'd just love something to eat. 
[15]I don't know. How do you taste? 
[16]Walk around the world. 
[17]Hang on-- 
[18]I don't like rats at the best of times, but this one was sounding an alarm. 
[19]You know, you're walking right into her trap. 
[20]Challenge her then. She may not play fair but she won't refuse. She's got a thing for games. 
[21]I think I mentioned that I don't like rats at the best of times. 
[22]It looked like you needed this one, however. 
[23]There!
dialogues.MISS FORCIBLE:
[1]April, I think you're being followed. 
[2]No, no, no, no. I'm sure she'd prefer Jasmine. 
[3]Ah, Jasmine it is, then. 
[4]Oh go on, have one ­ it's hand-pulled taffy from Brighton ­ best in the world. 
[5]Oh, give me that cup, April, your eyes are going. 
[6]Oh, now, ummm... not to worry, child, it's good news: there's a tall, handsome beast in your future. 
[7]I see a giraffe. 
[8]Oh, lord! 
[9]Acquire a very tall step ladder. 
[10]Toodle-oo. 
[11]April? Aren't you getting ready? 
[12]What?! We've waited months for those tickets. 
[13]With your gamy legs? It's nearly two miles to the theater! 
[14]No, they're good for lost things. 
[15]Lost things, April. 
[16]Lost. 
[17]Lost. 
[18]Lost. 
[19]Oh, look April - Pink Ladies! 
[20]Of course!
dialogues.TALL OTHER MOTHER:
[1]
[2]You may come out when you've learned to be a loving daughter! 
[3]Coraline? Is that you! 
[4]Coraline... 
[5]Coraline? How dare you disobey your mother!! 
[6]Coraline! 
[7]Gosh, I have no idea where your "old" parents are. Perhaps they've grown bored of you and run away to France? 
[8]Now, don't be difficult, Coraline. Have a seat, won't you? 
[9]Shhh! The garden squash need tending, don't you think, pumpkin? 
[10]Breakfast-time! 
[11]Everybody likes games. 
[12]What kind of game would it be? 
[13]Too easy. 
[14]Huh. 
[15]What if you don't find them? 
[16]Hmmm... And if you somehow win this game? 
[17]Deal. 
[18]Oh, right... In each of three wonders I've made just for you, a ghost's eye is lost in plain sight.
dialogues.BELDAM:
[1]So, you're back.... 
[2]And you brought vermin with you. 
[3]You know I love you. 
[4]So?     Where are they - the ghost eyes? 
[5]No, I suppose not. After all, you still need to find your old parents, don't you? Too bad you won't have this. 
[6]Well... produce them. 
[7]Oh, they are, are they? 
[8]You're wrong, Coraline! 
[9]They aren't there. 
[10]Now you're going to stay here forever. 
[11]
[12]You horrible cheating girl! 
[13]Noo!! Where are you? You selfish brat!! 
[14]Hahahaha... 
[15]
[16]
dialogues.SWEET GIRL GHOST:
[1]She spied on our lives, through the little doll's eyes, 
[2]and games to play! 
[3]yet we still wanted more - 
[4]Perhaps, if you do win your escape, you could find our eyes? 
[5]Yes, miss. And hidden them. 
[6]Be clever, miss; even if you win she'll never let you go! 
[7]It's a fine, fine thing you did for us, miss. 
[8]It is over and done with ... for us. 
[9]It's the key, miss, there's only one and the Beldam will find it.
dialogues.OTHER MISS SPINK:
[1]I'm known as the siren of all seven seas The breaker of hearts by the bay. 
[2]So, if you go swimmin' With bow-legged women, I might steal your weak heart away. 
[3]Beware of old oysters, too large in the chest, Let's banish them from the buffet. 
[4]I'm far more nutritious 
[5]Did I hear a banshee? 
[6]This mermaid enchantress, 
[7]Will send sailors swooning --oh--! 
[8]Ready to break a leg, Miriam?
dialogues.WYBIE'S GRANDMOTHER:
[1]Wyborne! 
[2]Wyborne! 
[3]Wyborne! 
[4]Wyborne!   Come home!! 
[5]Wyborne, I know where I'm going-- 
[6]--I grew up here. 
[7]Oh, hello.
dialogues.TALL GIRL GHOST:
[1]Hush! And shush! For the Beldam might be listening! 
[2]So she lured us away, 
[3]with treasures and treats, 
[4]So we let her sew the buttons. 
[5]But she locked us here 
[6]Hurry on, girl - her web is unwinding! 
[7]You're in terrible danger, girl!
dialogues.BOY GHOST:
[1]Don't remember our names... But I `member my true mommy... 
[2]And saw that we weren't    happy. 
[3]Gave all that we asked - 
[4]She said that she loved us, 
[5]Find our eyes, mistress, and our souls will be freed. 
[6]Bless you, miss, you found me! But there's two eyes still lost. 
[7]Tain't all bad, miss. Thou art alive ... thou art still ... living...
dialogues.OTHER MISS FORCIBLE:
[1]A big-bottomed sea witch may bob through the waves, And hope to lead sailors astray, But a true ocean goddess, Must fill out her bodice, To present an alluring display. 
[2]You smell like the fishes 
[3]You're sea-green with envy 
[4]No, I "Birth of Venus!" 
[5]Will send sailors swooning --oh--! 
[6]Our lives for the theater, April!
